trans-unit.source: Contains properties that you can use to query system settings.
Gets the border multiplier factor that determines the width of a window's sizing border.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.Border"></xref> property.
Gets the metric that determines the border width of the nonclient area of a nonminimized window.
The metric is obtained from SPI_GETNONCLIENTMETRICS.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.BorderWidth"></xref> property.
Gets the metric that determines the caption height for the nonclient area of a nonminimized window.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.CaptionHeight"></xref> property.
Gets the metric that determines the caption width for the nonclient area of a nonminimized window.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.CaptionWidth"></xref> property.
Gets the caret width, in pixels, for edit controls.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.CaretWidth"></xref> property.
Gets a value indicating whether the client area animation feature is enabled.
A Boolean value; **true** if client area animation is enabled, **false** otherwise.
Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.ClientAreaAnimation"></xref> property.
Gets a value indicating whether the slide-open effect for combo boxes is enabled.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.ComboBoxAnimation"></xref> property.
Gets the system value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Popup.PopupAnimation"></xref> property for combo boxes.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.ComboBoxPopupAnimation"></xref> property.
Gets the height, in pixels, of a cursor.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.CursorHeight"></xref> property.
Gets a value indicating whether the cursor has a shadow around it.
`true` if the shadow is enabled; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.CursorShadow"></xref> property.
Gets the width, in pixels, of a cursor.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.CursorWidth"></xref> property.
Gets a value indicating whether dragging of full windows is enabled.
`true` if dragging of full windows is enabled; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.DragFullWindows"></xref> property.
Gets a value indicating whether the drop shadow effect is enabled.
`true` if the drop shadow effect is enabled; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.DropShadow"></xref> property.
Gets the height of the horizontal border of the frame around a window.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.FixedFrameHorizontalBorderHeight"></xref> property.
Gets the width of the vertical border of the frame around a window.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.FixedFrameVerticalBorderWidth"></xref> property.
Gets a value indicating whether native menus appear as a flat menu.
`true` if the flat menu appearance is set; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.FlatMenu"></xref> property.
Gets the height, in pixels, of the upper and lower edges of the focus rectangle.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.FocusBorderHeight"></xref> property.
Gets the width, in pixels, of the left and right edges of the focus rectangle.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.FocusBorderWidth"></xref> property.
Gets the height of the upper and lower edges of the focus rectangle.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.FocusHorizontalBorderHeight"></xref> property.
Gets the width of the left and right edges of the focus rectangle.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.FocusVerticalBorderWidth"></xref> property.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the `FocusVisualStyle` property.
Gets the number of times the Set Foreground Window flashes the taskbar button when rejecting a foreground switch request.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.ForegroundFlashCount"></xref> property.
Gets the height, in pixels, of the client area for a full-screen window on the primary display monitor.
The height of the client area.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.FullPrimaryScreenHeight"></xref> property.
Gets the width, in pixels, of the client area for a full-screen window on the primary display monitor.
The width of the client area.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.FullPrimaryScreenWidth"></xref> property.
Gets a value indicating whether the gradient effect for window title bars is enabled.
`true` if the gradient effect is enabled; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.GradientCaptions"></xref> property.
Gets information about the High Contrast accessibility feature.
Maps to SPI_GETHIGHCONTRAST, which references HCF_HIGHCONTRASTON.
`true` if the HIGHCONTRASTON option is selected; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.HighContrast"></xref> property.
Gets the width, in pixels, of the arrow bitmap on a horizontal scroll bar.
The width of the arrow bitmap.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.HorizontalScrollBarButtonWidth"></xref> property.
Gets the height of a horizontal scroll bar, in pixels.
The height of the scroll bar.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.HorizontalScrollBarHeight"></xref> property.
Gets the width, in pixels, of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb"></xref> in a horizontal scroll bar.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.HorizontalScrollBarThumbWidth"></xref> property.
Gets a value indicating whether hot tracking of user-interface elements, such as menu names on menu bars, is enabled.
`true` if hot tracking is enabled; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.HotTracking"></xref> property.
Gets the height of a grid in which a large icon will fit.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.IconGridHeight"></xref> property.
Gets the width of a grid that a large icon will fit into.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.IconGridWidth"></xref> property.
Gets the default height of an icon.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.IconHeight"></xref> property.
Gets the width, in pixels, of an icon cell.
The system uses this rectangle to arrange icons in large icon view.
Maps to SPI_GETICONMETRICS, which references SPI_ICONHORIZONTALSPACING.
The width of an icon cell.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.IconHorizontalSpacing"></xref> property.
Gets a value indicating whether icon-title wrapping is enabled.
Maps to SPI_GETICONMETRICS, which references SPI_GETICONTITLEWRAP.
`true` if icon-title wrapping is enabled; otherwise `false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.IconTitleWrap"></xref> property.
Gets the height, in pixels, of an icon cell.
The system uses this rectangle to arrange icons in large icon view.
Maps to SPI_GETICONMETRICS, which references SPI_ICONVERTICALSPACING.
The height of an icon cell.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.IconVerticalSpacing"></xref> property.
Gets the default width of an icon.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.IconWidth"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates whether glass window frames are being used.
`true` if glass window frames are being used; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the system is ready to use a Unicode-based [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ime](~/includes/tlasharptla-ime-md.md)] on a Unicode application.
`true` if the Input Method Manager/Input Method Editor features are enabled; otherwise, `false`.``
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.IsImmEnabled"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates whether the current operating system is the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_whistler2](~/includes/tlasharptla-whistler2-md.md)] Media Center Edition.
`true` if the current operating system is [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_whistler2](~/includes/tla2sharptla-whistler2-md.md)] Media Center Edition; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.IsMediaCenter"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates whether drop-down menus are right-aligned with the corresponding menu item.
`true` if drop-down menus are right-aligned; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.IsMenuDropRightAligned"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates whether the system is enabled for Hebrew and Arabic languages.
`true` if the system is enabled for Hebrew and Arabic languages; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.IsMiddleEastEnabled"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates whether a mouse is installed.
This value is rarely `false`, because virtual mice are supported and because some systems detect the presence of the port, instead of a mouse.
`true` if a mouse is installed; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.IsMousePresent"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates whether the installed mouse has a vertical scroll wheel.
`true` if the installed mouse has a vertical scroll wheel; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.IsMouseWheelPresent"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates whether [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_win](~/includes/tlasharptla-win-md.md)] for Pen Computing extensions are installed.
`true` if Pen Computing extensions are installed; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.IsPenWindows"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates whether the current session is remotely controlled.
This system metric is used in a Terminal Services environment.
`true` if the current session is remotely controlled; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.IsRemotelyControlled"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates whether the calling process is associated with a Terminal Services client session.
This system metric is used in a Terminal Services environment.
`true` if the calling process is associated with a Terminal Services client session; `false` if the calling process is associated with the Terminal Server console session.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.IsRemoteSession"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates whether the computer has a low-end (slow) processor.
`true` if the computer has a low-end (slow) processor; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.IsSlowMachine"></xref> property.

Gets a value that indicates whether the current operating system is [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_whistler](~/includes/tlasharptla-whistler-md.md)] [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_tpc](~/includes/tlasharptla-tpc-md.md)] Edition.

`true` if the current operating system is [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_whistler](~/includes/tla2sharptla-whistler-md.md)] [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_tpc](~/includes/tla2sharptla-tpc-md.md)] Edition; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.IsTabletPC"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates the height, in pixels, of the kanji window at the bottom of the screen for systems that use double-byte characters.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.KanjiWindowHeight"></xref> property.
Gets a value indicating whether menu access keys are always underlined.
`true` if menu access keys are always underlined; `false` if they are underlined only when the menu is activated by the keyboard.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.KeyboardCues"></xref> property.
Gets the keyboard repeat-delay setting, which is a value in the range from 0 (approximately 250 milliseconds delay) through 3 (approximately 1 second delay).
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.KeyboardDelay"></xref> property.
Gets a value indicating whether the user relies on the keyboard instead of the mouse, and whether the user wants applications to display keyboard interfaces that are typically hidden.
`true` if the user relies on the keyboard; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.KeyboardPreference"></xref> property.
Gets the keyboard repeat-speed setting, which is a value in the range from 0 (approximately 2.5 repetitions per second) through 31 (approximately 30 repetitions per second).
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.KeyboardSpeed"></xref> property.
Gets a value indicating whether the smooth-scrolling effect for list boxes is enabled.
`true` if the smooth-scrolling effect is enabled; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.ListBoxSmoothScrolling"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates the height, in pixels, of a maximized top-level window on the primary display monitor.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.MaximizedPrimaryScreenHeight"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates the width, in pixels, of a maximized top-level window on the primary display monitor.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.MaximizedPrimaryScreenWidth"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates the maximum height, in pixels, of a window that has a caption and sizing borders.
This metric refers to the entire desktop.
The user cannot drag the window frame to a height larger than this dimension.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.MaximumWindowTrackHeight"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates the maximum width, in pixels, of a window that has a caption and sizing borders.
This metric refers to the entire desktop.
The user cannot drag the window frame to a width larger than this dimension.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.MaximumWindowTrackWidth"></xref> property.
Gets a value indicating whether the menu animation feature is enabled.
`true` if menu animation is enabled; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.MenuAnimation"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates the height, in pixels, of a single-line menu bar.
The height of the menu bar.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.MenuBarHeight"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates the height, in pixels, of a menu bar button.
The height of a menu bar button.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.MenuButtonHeight"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates the width, in pixels, of a menu bar button.
The width of a menu bar button.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.MenuButtonWidth"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates the height, in pixels, of the default menu check-mark bitmap.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.MenuCheckmarkHeight"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates the width, in pixels, of the default menu check-mark bitmap.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.MenuCheckmarkWidth"></xref> property.
Gets a value indicating whether pop-up menus are left-aligned or right-aligned, relative to the corresponding menu item.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.MenuDropAlignment"></xref> property.
Gets a value indicating whether menu fade animation is enabled.
If fade animation is disabled, menus use slide animation.
This flag is ignored unless menu animation is enabled.
`true` when fade animation is enabled; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.MenuFade"></xref> property.
Gets the metric that determines the height of the menu.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.MenuHeight"></xref> property.
Gets the system value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Popup.PopupAnimation"></xref> property for menus.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.MenuPopupAnimation"></xref> property.
Gets the time, in milliseconds, that the system waits before displaying a shortcut menu when the mouse cursor is over a submenu item.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.MenuShowDelay"></xref> property.
Gets the metric that determines the width of the menu.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.MenuWidth"></xref> property.
Gets the animation effects associated with user actions.
The SPI_GETANIMATION system parameter gets an [ANIMATIONINFO](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/sysinfo/base/animationinfo_str.asp) structure.
If the *iMinAnimate* member of the structure is non-zero the minimize animation effects are enabled.
`true` if the minimize window animations feature is enabled; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.MinimizeAnimation"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates the height, in pixels, of a grid cell for a minimized window.
Each minimized window fits into a rectangle with this height.
The value is always greater than or equal to <xref:System.Windows.SystemParameters.MinimizedWindowHeight%2A>.
The height of a grid cell for a minimized window.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.MinimizedGridHeight"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates the width, in pixels, of a grid cell for a minimized window.
Each minimized window fits into a rectangle with this width.
The value is always greater than or equal to <xref:System.Windows.SystemParameters.MinimizedWindowWidth%2A>.
The width of a grid cell for a minimized window.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.MinimizedGridWidth"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates the height, in pixels, of a minimized window.
The height of a minimized window.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.MinimizedWindowHeight"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates the width, in pixels, of a minimized window.
The width of a minimized window.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.MinimizedWindowWidth"></xref> property.
Gets the width of a rectangle centered on a drag point to allow for limited movement of the mouse pointer before a drag operation begins.
The width of the rectangle, in pixels.
Gets the height of a rectangle centered on a drag point to allow for limited movement of the mouse pointer before a drag operation begins.
The height of the rectangle, in pixels.
Gets a value that indicates the minimum height, in pixels, of a window.
The minimum height of a window.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.MinimumWindowHeight"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates the minimum tracking height of a window, in pixels.
The user cannot drag the window frame to a height smaller than this dimension.
The minimun tracking height of a window.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.MinimumWindowTrackHeight"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates the minimum tracking width of a window, in pixels.
The user cannot drag the window frame to a width smaller than this dimension.
The minimum tracking width of a window.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.MinimumWindowTrackWidth"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates the minimum width, in pixels, of a window.
The minimum width of a window.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.MinimumWindowWidth"></xref> property.
Gets the height, in pixels, of the rectangle within which the mouse pointer has to stay to generate a mouse-hover event.
The height of a rectangle used for a mouse-hover event.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.MouseHoverHeight"></xref> property.
Gets the time, in milliseconds, that the mouse pointer must remain in the hover rectangle to generate a mouse-hover event.
The time, in milliseconds, that the mouse must be in the hover rectangle to generate a mouse-hover event.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.MouseHoverTime"></xref> property.
Gets the width, in pixels, of the rectangle within which the mouse pointer has to stay to generate a mouse-hover event.
The width of a rectangle used for a mouse-hover event.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.MouseHoverWidth"></xref> property.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.NavigationChromeDownLevelStyleKey"></xref> property.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.NavigationChromeStyleKey"></xref> property.
Gets a value indicating whether the system power is online, or that the system power status is unknown.
Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.PowerLineStatus"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates the screen height, in pixels, of the primary display monitor.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.PrimaryScreenHeight"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates the screen width, in pixels, of the primary display monitor.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.PrimaryScreenWidth"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates the height (thickness), in pixels, of the horizontal sizing border around the perimeter of a window that can be resized.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.ResizeFrameHorizontalBorderHeight"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates the width (thickness), in pixels, of the vertical sizing border around the perimeter of a window that can be resized.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.ResizeFrameVerticalBorderWidth"></xref> property.
Gets the metric that determines the scroll height of the nonclient area of a nonminimized window.
The metric is obtained from SPI_GETNONCLIENTMETRICS.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.ScrollHeight"></xref> property.
Gets the metric that determines the scroll width of the nonclient area of a nonminimized window.
The metric is obtained from SPI_GETNONCLIENTMETRICS.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.ScrollWidth"></xref> property.
Gets a value indicating whether the selection fade effect is enabled.
The selection fade effect causes the menu item selected by the user to remain on the screen briefly while fading out after a menu is dismissed.
`true` if the fade effect is enabled; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.SelectionFade"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates whether the user requires information in visual format.
`true` if the user requires an application to present information visually where it typically presents the information only in audible form; otherwise `false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.ShowSounds"></xref> property.
Gets the metric that determines the height of the small caption of the nonclient area of a nonminimized window.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.SmallCaptionHeight"></xref> property.
Gets the metric that determines the width of the small caption of the nonclient area of a nonminimized window.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.SmallCaptionWidth"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates the recommended height, in pixels, of a small icon.
Small icons typically appear in window captions and in small-icon view.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.SmallIconHeight"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates the recommended width, in pixels, of a small icon.
Small icons typically appear in window captions and in small-icon view.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.SmallIconWidth"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates the height, in pixels, of small caption buttons.
The height of the caption button.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.SmallWindowCaptionButtonHeight"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates the width, in pixels, of small caption buttons.
The width of the caption button.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.SmallWindowCaptionButtonWidth"></xref> property.
Gets a value indicating whether the snap-to-default button is enabled.
If enabled, the mouse cursor automatically moves to the default button of a dialog box, such as **OK** or **Apply**.
`true` when the feature is enabled; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.SnapToDefaultButton"></xref> property.
Occurs when one of the properties changes.
Gets a value indicating whether hot tracking of a stylus is enabled.
`true` if hot tracking of a stylus is enabled; otherwise `false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.StylusHotTracking"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates whether the functionality of the left and right mouse buttons are swapped.
`true` if the functionality of the left and right mouse buttons are swapped; otherwise `false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.SwapButtons"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates the height, in pixels, of a [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_3d](~/includes/tlasharptla-3d-md.md)] border.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.ThickHorizontalBorderHeight"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates the width, in pixels, of a [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_3d](~/includes/tlasharptla-3d-md.md)] border.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.ThickVerticalBorderWidth"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates the height, in pixels, of a horizontal window border.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.ThinHorizontalBorderHeight"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates the width, in pixels, of a vertical window border.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.ThinVerticalBorderWidth"></xref> property.
Gets a value indicating whether <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolTip"></xref> animation is enabled.
`true` if ToolTip animation is enabled; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.ToolTipAnimation"></xref> property.
Gets a value indicating whether ToolTip animation uses a fade effect or a slide effect.
`true` if a fade effect is used; `false` if a slide effect is used.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.ToolTipFade"></xref> property.
Gets the system value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Popup.PopupAnimation"></xref> property for ToolTips.
A system value for the pop-up animation property.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.ToolTipPopupAnimation"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates whether all [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ui](~/includes/tlasharptla-ui-md.md)] effects are enabled.
`true` if all [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ui](~/includes/tla2sharptla-ui-md.md)] effects are enabled; `false` if they are disabled.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.UIEffects"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates the height, in pixels, of the arrow bitmap on a vertical scroll bar.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.VerticalScrollBarButtonHeight"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates the height, in pixels, of the thumb in a vertical scroll bar.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.VerticalScrollBarThumbHeight"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates the width, in pixels, of a vertical scroll bar.
The width of a scroll bar.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.VerticalScrollBarWidth"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates the height, in pixels, of the virtual screen.
The virtual screen is the bounding rectangle of all display monitors.

The <xref:System.Windows.SystemParameters.VirtualScreenTop%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.SystemParameters.VirtualScreenLeft%2A> metrics are the coordinates of the upper-left corner of the virtual screen.
The height of the virtual screen.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.VirtualScreenHeight"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates the coordinate for the left side of the virtual screen.
The virtual screen is the bounding rectangle of all display monitors.
The <xref:System.Windows.SystemParameters.VirtualScreenWidth%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.SystemParameters.VirtualScreenHeight%2A> metrics are the width and height of the virtual screen.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.VirtualScreenLeft"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates the upper coordinate of the virtual screen.
The virtual screen is the bounding rectangle of all display monitors.
The <xref:System.Windows.SystemParameters.VirtualScreenWidth%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.SystemParameters.VirtualScreenHeight%2A> metrics are the width and height of the virtual screen.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.VirtualScreenTop"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates the width, in pixels, of the virtual screen.
The virtual screen is the bounding rectangle of all display monitors.

The <xref:System.Windows.SystemParameters.VirtualScreenTop%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.SystemParameters.VirtualScreenLeft%2A> metrics are the coordinates of the upper-left corner of the virtual screen.
The width of the virtual screen.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.VirtualScreenWidth"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates the number of lines to scroll when the mouse wheel is rotated.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.WheelScrollLines"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates the height, in pixels, of a button in the title bar of a window.
The height of a caption button.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.WindowCaptionButtonHeight"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates the width, in pixels, of a button in the title bar of a window.
The width of a caption button.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.WindowCaptionButtonWidth"></xref> property.
Gets a value that indicates the height, in pixels, of a caption area.
The height of a caption area.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.WindowCaptionHeight"></xref> property.
Gets the radius of the corners for a window.
The degree to which the corners of a window are rounded.
Gets the brush that paints the glass window frame.
The brush that paints the glass window frame.
Gets the color that is used to paint the glass window frame.
The color that is used to paint the glass window frame.
Gets the size of the non-client area of the window.
The size of the non-client area of the window, in device-independent units (1/96th of an inch).
Gets the size of the resizing border around the window.
The size of the resizing border around the window, in device-independent units (1/96th of an inch).
Gets the size of the work area on the primary display monitor.
The work area is the portion of the screen that is not obscured by the system taskbar or by application desktop toolbars.
A `RECT` structure that receives the work area coordinates, expressed as virtual screen coordinates.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemParameters.WorkArea"></xref> property.
